array.string: Now Little AI can flip the tiles on its left and on its right.
It can experience a delightful interaction in a specific configuration of the environment.
This group of levels illustrates the problem of learning the persistence of complex objects in the world from initially uninterpreted experiences.
Little AI begins to manipulate a more complex object made of two different parts.
We currently don't have algorithms that can play levels 200 to 202. If you wish to contribute to research in developmental AI, you may address this problem.
You may also invent more levels that exemplify the problem of learning the existence of more complex object from experience of interaction.
